pages.text: Accessing new spells requires a special machine designed to convert reagents into spell glyphs. These glyphs can be used to unlock new spells in a spell book or may be used in special crafting recipes. Creating a glyph will require a special form of magical clay, a reagent for the spell, and nearby mana provided by a mana jar. To use the glyph press, first place your clay into the press.

Then, use the reagent provided on the press. If there is enough mana nearby, the press will begin crafting. Mana can be provided by a nearby Mana Jar. The glyph press may be automated using Hoppers. A hopper from any side will place Clay, while a hopper from the top can insert the reagent for the clay. If there is enough mana nearby, the crafting will start automatically. If a chest is adjacent to the glyph press, glyphs will be deposited automatically.
